title: Economics: Goods and Services

vocab.definition: Things people make or grow that can be bought and sold
Work that people do to help others
Someone who makes or grows goods
Someone who buys and uses goods and services

teachingNotes: Use real-world examples from students' lives. Discuss local businesses and what they provide. Connect to community helpers and their services.

sample.question: What is the difference between goods and services?
expectedAny: goods are objects; services are actions

sample.question: Who is a producer?
expectedAny: someone who makes or grows goods

sample.question: Who is a consumer?
expectedAny: someone who buys and uses goods and services

sample.question: Name a service you used recently.

truefalse.question: A haircut is an example of a service.
Services are things you can touch.

multiplechoice.question: Which is an example of goods?
Which could be goods at a store?

fillintheblank.question: When you buy bread at the store, the bread is _____ and you are the _____.
A person who buys things is a ________.
A person who makes things is a ________.
Services are ________ people do to help others.
Goods are ________ you can buy and touch.

shortanswer.question: How are producers and consumers connected?
expectedAny: producers make things that consumers buy

shortanswer.question: Give an example of trading goods or services.
Name two services your family uses.
What goods do you use at school?
Why do people trade?
expectedAny: to get what they need or want

shortanswer.question: What is one job that provides a service?
